content: There are many serious issues raised by the TransPacific Partnership TPP but the one that may have the greatest longterm impact is its provisions on drug patents The explicit purpose is to make patent protection stronger and longer While these provisions are likely to lead to higher drug prices in the United States they will have their greatest impact in the developing world In most developing countries drugs are far cheaper than in the United States This is especially the case in India The country has a worldclass generic industry that produces highquality drugs that typically sell for a small fraction of the price in the United States The US drug industry desperately wants to eliminate this sort of price gap which can exceed a ratio of one hundred to one This should have everyone very worried
